passage_text: Take a bus from Niagara Falls to New York City. Try Greyhound or City2City-bus. You can take Greyhound from Niagara Falls, Ontario or Niagara Falls, New York to destinations throughout New York, including New York City's Penn Station.

Driving distance from New York, NY to Niagara Falls, NY. The total driving distance from New York, NY to Niagara Falls, NY is 409 miles or 658 kilometers. Your trip begins in New York, New York. It ends in Niagara Falls

By Amtrak train, it takes about 8 hours to travel from Penn Station to Niagara Falls, including a ~20 minute stop in Albany and additional station stops. If you take the train, be sure to arrange for a rental car/taxi to meet you in either Buffalo or Niagara Falls, as the station is nowhere near downtown.

Driving distance from Niagara Falls, Canada to New York, NY. The total driving distance from Niagara Falls, Canada to New York, NY is 412 miles or 663 kilometers. Your trip begins in Niagara Falls, Canada.

Best Answer: Not counting for traffic, it takes at least 7 hours (if you go the speed limit) to drive nonstop from City Hall in Lower Manhattan to downtown Niagara Falls; a distance of slightly under 400 miles.

Niagara Falls is located on the US-Canadian border in far-western New York State, approximately 400 miles (nearly 700 km) from New York City, a distance of 7 to 8 hours by road. The nearest airport is Buffalo-Niagara International Airport (NY), approximately 25 miles (42 km) away.
